situation.title: When to seek medical attention
situation.meta_description: Description of symptoms inducing medical attention.

content.processed:
When to seek medical attention

  • If you have difficulty with breathing or a fever (higher than 38 °C) together with a dry cough, call 155 immediately and follow the operator's instructions.
  • If you have a fever that lasts for more than two days or a dry cough without a fever, contact your GP or Emergency (outside of GP's hours) and follow their instructions.
  • If you are over 60 years old and have any of the above symptoms, call your GP or Emergency (outside of GP'd hours) and follow their instructions.
     

If you do not have any of these symptoms, monitor your health regularly, and measure your temperature twice a day.
